news_header: Ukraine's president reports the return of North Korean forces to the front lines in the Kursk region, following heavy casualties last month.
news_original_title: Zelensky says North Korean troops back on front line
news_text: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky announced that North Korean troops have returned to the front lines in Russia's Kursk region after being withdrawn due to significant losses. He stated that these soldiers are involved in new assaults and that hundreds of military personnel from both Russia and North Korea have been destroyed. Reports indicate that North Korean soldiers are unprepared for modern warfare and vulnerable to Ukrainian drones. The ongoing conflict has resulted in heavy casualties on both sides, with estimates suggesting up to 350,000 Russian soldiers and 45,100 Ukrainian soldiers killed. Despite recent Ukrainian advances, Russian forces claim to have repelled attacks.
